snippet: With long lines persisting at gas pumps, Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg said an odd-even rationing rule would go into effect at 6 a.m. Friday, and counties on Long Island announced a similar system.
abstract: New York Mayor Michael R Bloomberg, with long lines persisting at gas pumps, says  odd-even rationing rule will go into effect at 6 am Nov 9; Nassau and Suffolk counties on Long Island announce similar system.

byline.contributor: Clifford Krauss, William K. Rashbaum and Nate Schweber contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: With long lines persisting at gas pumps, Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg said an odd-even rationing rule would go into effect at 6 a.m. Friday, and counties on Long Island announced a similar system.

headline.seo: New York City Imposes Gas Rationing to Ease Shortage
headline.main: Mayor Mandates Rationing of Gas to Ease Shortage
headline.print_headline: Mayor Mandates Rationing of Gas To Ease Shortage
